body_html:
Hi @cliff, the problem was eventually solved by manually compiling a version that had only the right GPU compile flags set. What I can't understand is why uninstalling the GPU enabled version and reinstalling the CPU only version didn't work. It kept failing at import. Could it be that the uninstall is not exhaustive? Sadly we can't reproduce this error at this point. Julien
…
On Wed, May 9, 2018 at 8:03 PM, Cliff Young ***@***.***> wrote: @Djoels <https://github.com/Djoels> and @jattenberg <https://github.com/jattenberg> can you post more exhaustive error logging, please, including the command that triggered the errors? It seems unlikely to me that this is the same problem, given that one of you is on x86 and one is on ARM. But they could both be build/configuration issues. — You are receiving this because you were mentioned. Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub <#17373 (comment)>, or mute the thread <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AITf4tKAULx5uigcLYEmyK6rq4pt5apyks5twy9jgaJpZM4SZiSs> .

body:
Hi @Cliff, the problem was eventually solved by manually compiling a
version that had only the right GPU compile flags set.
What I can't understand is why uninstalling the GPU enabled version and
reinstalling the CPU only version didn't work. It kept failing at import.
Could it be that the uninstall is not exhaustive? Sadly we can't reproduce
this error at this point.

Julien

On Wed, May 9, 2018 at 8:03 PM, Cliff Young <notifications@github.com>
wrote:

> @Djoels <https://github.com/Djoels> and @jattenberg
> <https://github.com/jattenberg> can you post more exhaustive error
> logging, please, including the command that triggered the errors?
>
> It seems unlikely to me that this is the same problem, given that one of
> you is on x86 and one is on ARM. But they could both be build/configuration
> issues.
>
> —
